intro: Schlechteranthus connatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved schlechteranthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a distinctive pink or purple hue. Schlechteranthus connatus is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
